p: From 24 to 30 mature seeds were used from each population for biometric analysis. We measured four quantified seed traits: seed length (SL), seed width (SW), seed circumference (SC), and seed area (SA). The seeds were measured as previously described in Rewicz et al. (2017). In order to describe the seed mass, we used 15 seeds from each population. The seeds were weighed with an Ohaus PA 21. We determined roundness by the formula: R = 4 × area/ π [Major axis] 2 as defined by Ferreira & Wayne (2010).
